div1.p: Hench requests copies of publications pertaining to the U.S. Army Yellow Fever Commission.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Superintendent of Documents, Government Printing Office, January 29, 1941
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
January 29, 1941
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
Superintendent of Documents
Government Printing Office
Washington, D. C.
RECEIVED
SUPERINTENDENT OF DOCUMENTS
FEB
1
1941
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I have been asked by the Minister of Defense of the Cuban govern-
ment to present to him documentary evidence to be used in the establishment of
the true sites used by the U.S. Army Yellow Fever Commission (Drs. Walter Reed
and colleagues) in 1900, during the experiments which successfully identified
the cause of yellow fever. I would greatly appreciate assistance in obtaining
for purchase (or if this is not possible, for a loan) the following government
documents.

1. Annual reports of the Governor General of Cuba for the years
1899 to 1902, inclusive. In particular, the following three documents:
(a) U.S. Adjutant General's Office, Cuban division; annual
report of the Commanding General, 1899. W25.8:899
(b) Same for 1900. -W1.1: 1 Vol 1 fol 11, fol 12
(c) Same for 1901. W25.1:

May I also obtain the Farmer's Bulletin, #51354 (“The Yellow Fever
Mosquito”) published October 1923 by L. O. Howard; also “A Few General Directions
With Regard to Destroying Mosquitoes, Particularly the Yellow Fever Mosquito” by
W. C. Gorgas, 1904. If these two publications are no longer available, perhaps
they have been republished later.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
